Case reference: 2014005882.CaseDesc: Romeo Cloutier was last seen September 13, 2012 in Moncton (NB). His vehicle was located in Sainte-Marie-de-Kent later on that same day. No other confirmed reports of his whereabouts have been made since.

Tattoo: Neck, Inscription "Keep your friends close, keep enemies closer"

Case reference: 2014004496.CaseDesc: Peter Cortner was last seen on May 20, 2004. He was reported missing by his apartment manager where he resided in Downtown Vancouver. He had left all his belongings behind in his apartment suite and dissapeared without notice.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.
Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand

Case reference: 2014002868.CaseDesc: On August 2, 1989, Ronald Jack last spoke with his mother. During that telephone discussion, Ronald had informed her that he and his wife, Doreen Jack, would be leaving for a “camp job”. He had also said that they would be gone for approximately 10 days, and would be back before their sons, Russell and Ryan Jack, started their school year in September.

Case reference: 2016061850.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1978, the body of a male was found in the snow on the east side of the Bayview Extension, near the east end of Labatt Ave, on the west bank of the Don River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 158lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present.

Hair: Brown, Grey, Unshaven, beard and moustache
Pyjama: Blue, White, Blue and white patterned pyjama bottoms
Coat: Dark grey winter coat with a checkered pattern
Scarf: Black, blue and red plaid scarf
Shirt: Maroon, Black, Maroon and black sport shirt
Scar: Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars on a forearm
Abdomen, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Shoulders, Numerous small, old, healed, circular scars
Mark: Left Hip, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Right Arm, Number of unswollen red-brown, circular contusions
Left Abdomen, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Right Leg, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
Left Thigh, Numerous small fairly recent abrasions
3 scabbed abrasions around the left eye orbit.

Case reference: 2014001755.CaseDesc: On July 19, 1982, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Howard Dobie was seen for the last time as he left his residence in Montreal, Quebec. Howard had left without saying where he was going. At the time of his disappearance, Howard was despondent and suffering from mental health issues.

Case reference: 2014003840.CaseDesc: On December 7, 1986, a male was seen floating in the river. The male initially responded to police calls however shortly after he was observed going under the water. It is presumed he drowned. The identity of the male was unknown to police until Roderick Cook's parents contacted police advising they had not seen their son for some time. It is assumed the man in the river was Roderick based both on the description and the fact that he was seen walking near the river. Police further found footprints that led from the shore to the open water. No foul play is suspected in this matter and it is assumed Mr. Cook drowned.

Teeth: Two front upper teeth are false

Case reference: 2017021464.CaseDesc: Since April 14, 2017, Deborah Anne Hutchinson's family has not seen or heard from her. Deborah's vehicle was later located in the Cossitt Heights area.

Case reference: 2016052751.CaseDesc: On August 4, 2016, Suchand Reddy Pingli was seen for the last time at his apartment in the Le Plateau-Mont-Royal District of Montreal, Quebec. Suchand suffers from health problems and has to take medication regularly. He is from India.

Case reference: 2016061373.CaseDesc: On March 30, 1980, an unidentified male was discovered floating in Lake Ontario at the rear of 2115 Lakeshore Blvd West. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he had moderate osteoarthritis of spine.

Case reference: 2012020006.CaseDesc: Lucas James Degerness was last seen on June 7, 2007 in Prince George, British-Columbia. He spent that night with a friend.

Mark: Torso (Back), Brown in color, left side
Head, Dime size bald spot - front

Case reference: 2014004125.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1979, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP Detachment received a report that David Voisey had gone through the ice while riding as a passenger on a snowmobile near Epinette Point, North West River, Newfoundland and Labrador. Mr. Voisey  has never been located.

Case reference: 2014005355.CaseDesc: In November of 1990, Jose Valdez was last seen by a friend at his residence located in Edmonton, Alberta. Jose has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003281.CaseDesc: On November 14, 1971, at around 6:30 am, Eileen “Gail” McCarthy was last seen leaving her home in Edmonton, Alberta to go to work at the Misericordia Hospital. Eileen worked as a nurse and did not arrive at work that day. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Coat: Brown, White, Brown Coat with White Fur Collar

Case reference: 2014006341.CaseDesc: Alma Mae Gillespie has been missing since June 10th, 1996 from her residence in Winnipeg, MB. Prior to her disappearance, she talked of wanting to go away and disappear for a while.  This has been done on numerous occasions before, even for years at a time.  In the past she has resurfaced within either the United States or Canada.

Case reference: 2014004358.CaseDesc: On August 5, 2003 Rahul Arora was last seen leaving the Trappers Inn in Parry Sound, Ontario.  He was possibly heading to the Toronto area to catch a flight.

Hair: Black, Straight, Ear length, parted in middle, dyed copper

Case reference: 2014005870.CaseDesc: On May 22, 2012, André Bellemare was last seen by his wife at his residence in Trois-Rivières, QC. On May 24, 2012, Mr. Bellemare’s vehicle was found abandoned in the woods near the ZEC Tawachiche territory, located in the municipality of Lac-aux-Sables. Despite the discovery of the vehicle, so far the searches have been unsuccessful in locating Mr. Bellemare.

Shoes: Brown, Size 10, Treking North Face brand
Shirt: Cotton, Blue, White, Plaid, size XL

Case reference: 2014003860.CaseDesc: Carl Charles Raun was reported missing on July 28, 1975. Mr. Raun had a fused spine, causing him to wear a brace, as well as a scar from back surgery. There is a possibility that Mr. Raun disappeared as a result of foul play, however this has not been confirmed.

Case reference: 2014001853.CaseDesc: On May 19, 1958, Clifford McKell and a friend were last seen having supper and told friends they were going out in the canoe. Neither of the men were considered experienced paddlers. No one witnessed the men leaving in the canoe. The following day they were reported missing by their employer when they failed to report to work. Police commenced an investigation and an air search found the overturned canoe. Paddles and safety cushions were also located. A witness who saw two men in a canoe around 8:30 pm indicated they were headed in a southerly direction and the lake was quite rough at the time. It is presumed Mr. McKell drowned.

Case reference: 2006020899.CaseDesc: Pooran Shivcharan, age 36, was last seen in an aircraft heading west bound in the direction of Geraldton, Ontario on November 13, 1981. Although he was originally headed toward Thunder Bay, he may have altered his course towards Geraldton or Raith.  Search efforts were unable to locate Mr. Shivcharan or his aircraft.

Case reference: 2012020129.CaseDesc: Nadine Lussier and Dominic Gauthier worked at a convenience store in Ste-Sophie. They were seen for the last time Wednesday, June 16th 2004. They left the convenience store around 3:00 p.m., and were then seen in a Prévost restaurant. Ms.Lussier's vehicle had not moved from the restaurant from the evening of Wednesday, June 16th 2004 and the time Dominic Gauthier's mother reported their disappearance on Friday June 18th 2004.

Case reference: 2014005676.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2011, Jimmy Larrivée was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. Jimmy had indicated that he wanted to spend the day in Rigaud, Quebec. That day, he was seen at a tanning salon on Monk Boulevard in the Ville-Émard District of Montreal. Jimmy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Jewelry: Brown, Necklace with a cross-shaped pendant
Scar: Upper Left Back, Left shoulder blade

Case reference: 2020009419.CaseDesc: On August 6, 1989, at approximately 12:00pm, Jessica Sakouhi was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Jessica was visiting from France and was due to return back on August 19, but she did not board the plane.

Case reference: 2008016399.CaseDesc: Nikki Lysanewitch has been missing since July 1994.  He was last seen leaving his residence near Bobcaygeon, Ontario.  His pick-up truck was later found parked at the Toronto International Airport.

Case reference: 2014001225.CaseDesc: On November 6, 1971, the body of a young adult man was found at the Broadway Hotel Bar (now the Sunrise Hotel) on Hastings Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had recently had cranial surgery for a head injury, wore upper partial denture and went by the name “John”.

Case reference: 2006019199.CaseDesc: Marion Thiessen was reported missing by her husband in November, 1979. She has gone missing several times in the past and it has been discovered that she lived in Vancouver, British Columbia about 28 years ago.  She contacted an acquaintance in 1984, but there has been no contact with Marion Thiessen since that time.

Teeth: False, Partial dentures on both lower and upper teeth.

Case reference: 2020007795.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1972, at around midnight, James Edwards was last seen in his Toronto Transit Commission (TTC) uniform leaving for work in Toronto, Ontario. TTC advised that James had submitted his resignation before his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001067.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1993, the body of an unidentified elderly woman was found in the Fraser River, upstream from the city of New Westminster, British-Columbia. She wore a single octagonal silver ring on her left hand and had full dentures.

Ring: Silver, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Third finger on left hand, octagonal shape

Case reference: 2018013207.CaseDesc: On the morning of March 12, 2018, Ariel Kouakou left his home, on foot, to go to a friend’s house. At around 11:15 am, a witness walking a dog saw Ariel on the bicycle path in Park of la Merci located between Gouin Boulevard and the Rivière des Prairies.

Case reference: 2022057067.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2022, Shirley Woodhouse was seen for the last time at her apartment in Saint John, New Brunswick. A few days later, on November 11, 2022, her vehicle was discovered parked on Red Head road near Cape Spencer, New Brunswick.

Case reference: 2005004099.CaseDesc: On August 18, 1999, this male was found in the Niagara River, near the Whirlpool. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 146 lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is estimated to have been in the water for a few days at most.

Teeth: He had an upper denture and his lower teeth were in poor condition.
Socks: White, Beige, a single white and beige sock
Tattoo: Right Arm, "LINDA" in black ink with a heart above the letter "i", 12.5X4 cm

Case reference: 2014004393.CaseDesc: Jean Garnek lived in an apartment block in the McGregor area of the city, where she was known to walk wherever she needed to go. She was also known to use the Winnipeg Transit System.

Case reference: 2014002701.CaseDesc: On November 25, 1986, Carol Bigtobacco was reported missing to the RCMP. She was 8 years old when she was last seen 3 years earlier on March 19, 1983. It is believed she had wandered off from the family residence on Siksika Nation. She may have suffered from a disability.

Boots: One boot was found, unknown colour

Case reference: 2016065867.CaseDesc:
On May 1, 1976 the skeletal remains of a male, were located in area of heavy bush north of Hwy 17 (0.5 miles east of Hodder Avenue on the Lakehead Expressway near a scenic lookout), Thunder Bay.
Police reports approximate the height of the deceased to be 5'8", however, no anthropological analysis was carried out on the long bones so this value is merely a non-scientific estimate. It is believed that he died approximately 10 months to 5 years prior to discovery.

Hair: Brown, Long, Tied back with elastic fasteners with plastic balls
Teeth: Complete acrylic upper denture. Several molars & premolars extracted from lower jaw. Many remaining teeth show signs of decay
Other: Paper matches with the zodiac theme "the moon" on them
Shirt: Grey or off-white sweatshirt with a crew neck collar
Belt: Leather, Brown, 37" from the hole used to the tongue of the buckle

Case reference: 2012020059.CaseDesc: On August 13, 1967, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Sylvia Klayh was seen for the last time as she left her family’s cottage in Brereton Lake, Manitoba. Prior to her disappearance, Sylvia had a verbal disagreement with her father, and left the cottage without saying anything. There is a possibility of foul play, as she has never attempted to contact any of her family members.

Case reference: 2016061073.CaseDesc: On July 13, 1980, the remains of a male was recovered from the Niagara River Whirlpool. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'9"; however, this measurement may not represent his actual living height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated he has been in the water for possibly 2 weeks.

Teeth: Has good teeth with several amalgam fillings of the molars.

Case reference: 2012020164.CaseDesc: These remains were located on the South West Marine Drive off-ramp below the north end of the Arthur Laing Bridge.

Case reference: 2016064577.CaseDesc: On December 9, 1982, the remains of an adult male were discovered outside of a burning shed at 348 Front Street West, with burns to the body. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 139lbs and his length was measured between 5'4" and 5'9", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.  His appendix was present. It is likely that he was an alcoholic.

Deformity: Torso (Back), Spine was curved to the side and the front; this may have been noticeable

Case reference: 2014004588.CaseDesc: On November 23, 1986, Pierre-Jean Durocher was last seen. He was reported missing on November 25, 1986, by a family member. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. Durocher lived in a rooming house in Longueuil. His backpack containing his identification was found on the Jacques Cartier Bridge in Montreal.

Case reference: 2006017899.CaseDesc: On September 8, 1973, John Begolo was last seen in Eganville, Ontario.  John indicated that he was planning to return to St. Catherine's, Ontario, by bus.  John has not been seen or heard from since.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Canadian Flag and Maple Leaf
Left Forearm, Nude woman entwined by snake

Case reference: 2014004917.CaseDesc: Robert Rudish and Lee Vrba arrived in Island Lake Manitoba on June 11, 1972, to fish. On June 17, RCMP received a report that a canoe was found overturned in the water. The canoe was soon identified as belonging to Mr. Vrba. RCMP Investigators surmised the men went missing on either the Thursday or the Friday. The weather on both days was extreme, with high winds gusting to 30 mph, which caused the lake to be quite rough. Neither of the two men have been located and it is presumed both drowned.

Tattoo: tattoo on right or left forearm

Case reference: 2014001032.CaseDesc: On June 11, 1999, a man committed suicide in front of a train near Wellington Street on the Lachine Canal. He was found lying on the railroad tracks.

Mark: Left Knee, erosion of the knee
Right Knee, erosion of the knee

Case reference: 2018063238.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2001, Edward Pinarreto was seen for the last time when he left Toronto, Ontario, for a two-week vacation in Cuba. Edward was scheduled to return to Toronto on February 3, but never board his flight.

Case reference: 2008015499.CaseDesc: Sheryl Sheppard was last seen on January 2 1998, on Lundy's Lane in Niagara Falls, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Hamilton Police Service was conducted but Sheryl Sheppard has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012000299.CaseDesc: Investigators with York Regional Police Homicide Unit are seeking assistance from the public in their investigation into the disappearance of a 45 year old woman. Cheryl Rowe was last seen by her family on December 22, 2011, just after midnight on Rathfon Crescent in the Town of Richmond Hill. The investigation is still ongoing and investigators believe that Ms. Rowe may be the victim of foul play.

Tattoo: Upper Back, children's names, two wings with the words "Shane" and "Christina"

Case reference: 2020011412.CaseDesc: On July 10, 1985, at approximately 11:00pm, Tahiya Shiekh was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Tahiya had been having ongoing disputes with her parents.

Case reference: 2014005271.CaseDesc: On May 23, 2009, Fanzheng Meng was seen for the last time at Britannia Park and Beach in Ottawa, Ontario. Mr. Meng and another man had been aboard an inflatable raft on the Ottawa River. The two men did not return to the shore and the deflated raft was subsequently located.

Case reference: 2014002912.CaseDesc: On June 29, 1982, Serge Aumont was seen for the last time in the Hochelaga district of Montreal, Quebec. Serge left his mother’s home with a friend to go to a medical clinic. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Foreign Object: Mouth, Upper and lower partial dentures

Case reference: 2012020077.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1986, Alexander Wiwchar, 72 years old, was last seen at 2:00 p.m. in Yorkton, SK. Mr. Wiwchar, who lived on a farm near Canora, SK, was seen at the Yorkton Bus Depot. Mr. Wiwchar is believed to have had some medical concerns and was suspected of having Alzheimer’s disease. His destination was unknown and he has not been seen or located since.

Mark: Chest, 9th rib fractured on the right side

Case reference: 2014003594.CaseDesc: On November 12, 1984, Pamela Asprey was last seen getting into a vehicle near the National War Memorial in St. John’s, Newfoundland. The male driver was described as having a large build and wore a baseball hat. That evening, Ms. Asprey had gone to a bar near where she was last seen. She had left her wallet at the bar and had advised her friend that she would be back in twenty minutes. Pamela was known to frequent the Duckwork Street area in St. John’s.

Tattoo: Shoulders, Greek writing on right shoulder

Case reference: 1999108210.CaseDesc: René Bessette was abducted when he was 8 years old by his father, Roger Bessette, leaving behind his mother and siblings.  His father's car was found abandoned later on the Victoria Bridge in Montreal.  The photos of René have been age-progressed to 40 years old.

Case reference: 2017047772.CaseDesc: On August 15, 2017, Moacir Ferrari was seen for the last time leaving his home with his belongings in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000088.CaseDesc: On February 19, 1973, Pierre Gariepy was seen for the last time in the Plateau-Mont-Royal district of Montreal, Quebec. Pierre is manic-depressive and was frequently hospitalized.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2013000075.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1988, Jean Berthiaume was seen for the last time in the Mount Royal area of Montreal, Quebec. Jean's vehicle was located at the Dorval Airport in Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Deformity: Right Arm, Smaller than the left
Scar: Right Upper Arm , "U" shape above the elbow

Case reference: 2014002368.CaseDesc: On June 11th, 1969, at approximately 5:50 PM, the Happy Valley-Goose Bay RCMP received a report of an empty boat drifting in Lake Melville, in the vicinity of North West Point, North West River, NL.  Police attended and learned that this empty boat belonged to Lawrence Alton Oliver, who had been reported to have departed his residence earlier in the morning to go seal hunting.  It is believed that Mr. Oliver fell overboard while hunting and drowned.  The body of Mr. Oliver has never been located.

Boots: Rubber, Brown, Red, Rubber hip waders with a red band

Case reference: 2014005742.CaseDesc: Philip Mark Oslizlok was reported missing by his family in early 2010. He was last seen on September 2, 2009 when he went to the Vancouver Police Department to receive an employment record clearance. Mr. Oslizlok last contacted his family via email on November 20, 2009 to inform them that he had gotten a job on a cruise line and would not be returning home for Christmas. There are no records of employment for Philip at any of the cruise lines. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006318.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2013, it is believed that Stewart Ward travelled from Brampton to Niagara Falls, Ontario.  Stewart's vehicle was later located in a parking lot near the Falls.  Stewart has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2015011664.CaseDesc: On July 6, 1994, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 25-35 was found in the waters of the St. Lawrence River near the Old Port of Montreal Clock Tower in Montreal, Quebec.

Sweater: Cotton, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, Fruit of the Loom brand, T-shirt with short sleeves, faded, size medium
Scar: Right Hand, 2.4 cm at the base of the thumb

Case reference: 2014005317.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1996, Sabrina John was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Sabrina’s parents had gotten into an argument that night, and the following day she and her mother had left their home with their clothing.

Case reference: 2014005776.CaseDesc: James Turgeon was last seen on Wednesday, April 17, 2012 at approximately 3:00 p.m. traveling East on foot on Highway #16 near North Battleford, SK. Mr. Turgeon has known mental health issues and has been diagnosed with schizophrenia. He has a history of walking away from his residence, but will usually return. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2008000799.CaseDesc: On August 26th, 1986 Terry FIELD and Linda BLACKWELL left Lost Nation Airport, east of Cleveland, Ohio en route to Brantford Municipal Airport, Brantford, Ontario.  The plane was 18 minutes into its flight when the pilot communicated with Cleveland Air Traffic Control that they were encountering severe turbulence.  They requested new vectors to fly. The pilot was advised to turn west, then Air Traffic Control lost radio and radar contact with the plane. Debris from the plane was located on August 27, 1986 in Lake Erie, approximately 32 nautical miles south of the St.Thomas Airport. Debris was drifting in a southeast direction and was recovered approximately 1-3 nautical miles on the Canadian side of the international boundary line in Lake Erie. Debris was identified by Bud FIELD,  brother of Terry FIELD, as having come from the missing aircraft.

Case reference: 2018010790.CaseDesc: In December of 2017, Willard Duval was seen last in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Willard had not been seen or heard from in two months.

Case reference: 2014003138.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1981, John Sanderson was with some friends in Berens River, Manitoba.  He left in a 22' boat heading for Jackhead, Manitoba.  Friends tried to stop him from leaving due to the high winds but he left anyway. On October 19, 1981, the boat that he had taken was found upside down and partly submerged near the shore of Pigeon Point. Gas cans that had been in the boat were also located.  Searches were done by air and water but the body of John was never found. It is presumed that Mr. Sanderson drowned.

Case reference: 2006012599.CaseDesc: Ralph Grant was last seen in the Huntsville area between January 28 and February 22, 1999. He resided on Yearly Road, Huntsville.

Amputation: Lower jaw surgically removed due to cancer

Case reference: 2013000121.CaseDesc: On October 13, 2012, human remains were located near Cochrane, Alberta. The Calgary Medical Examiner has determined that the remains are those of a white man between the ages of 20 and 60 years old.  The remains had been decomposing for less than a year prior to being discovered.  This man had once suffered a broken nose that had healed.

Case reference: 2019015560.CaseDesc: On March 26, 2019, Donna Paré was reported missing in Montreal, Quebec. Donna last communicated with her family in December 2018, and is known to live a transient lifestyle. She is known to frequent the Berri-UQAM and Place-des-Arts metro stations, and the McDonald’s on Sainte-Catherine Street East and Berri Park in Montreal, Quebec. Donna’s family has reason to fear for her health and safety.

Case reference: 2006020099.CaseDesc: On October 1, 1974, Louis Wesley was last seen in Chamberlain Narrows, Lac Seul. He was involved in a boating accident and is presumed to have drowned in the lake, 48 km north of Hudson. His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2014005961.CaseDesc: Chris Metallic had been attending a party at a residence in Sackville on Saturday night but was last seen in Sackville at approximately 3 a.m. on Sunday, November 25, 2012. A search for Mr. Metallic focused on a wooded area and river off of Route 940 heading toward Shemogue after information was received that a person was seen walking on the Upper Aboujagne Road around 5:30 a.m. on Sunday morning.

Deformity: Unknown, Crooked fingers on left hand

Case reference: 2009247848.CaseDesc: Christopher and Alexander are missing from the York region but were located in Poland where they are residing with their non-custodial mother.

Case reference: 2014005222.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2008, at approximately noon, Syed Zaman was seen for the last time at his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014002831.CaseDesc: On December 26, 1980, Zulfiqar Charania was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. During the time of his disappearance, Zulfiqar lived in Ottawa but was at his sister’s home in Montreal to spend the holidays. When Zulfiqar left Montreal he did so without his suitcase, which was filled with his personal belongings. Zulfiqar had indicated that he intended on travelling to New York in the United States to visit another family member.

Case reference: 2017076317.CaseDesc: Dakota Anzovino was last seen on December 23, 2017, in the City of Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Boots: Tan, Black, Winter, Brand: "Sorel"; with white fur
Jeans: Denim, Grey, Light Blue, Or grey in colour
Jacket: Black, Grey, Plaid with dark hood

Case reference: 2019052112.CaseDesc: On November 13, 1974, the body of an elderly man was found in a parking lot on East Hastings St in Vancouver, British Columbia. He had grey hair and a moustache and was believed to be living a transient lifestyle. He died of heart disease.

Case reference: 2006002299.CaseDesc: On May 11, 1995, remains from an unidentified man were discovered in Grenadier Pond, also known as “Duck Pond”, in High Park in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2012020107.CaseDesc: Isabelle Bourgeot, 32, was seen for the last time on November 1st, 1985 in the La Cité-Limoilou district in Quebec City, Quebec. At the time of her disappearance Isabelle wasn’t carrying any identification papers. It should be noted that she suffers from amnesia.

Case reference: 2014006329.CaseDesc: On November 22, 2013, David Czerman was taken to Surrey Memorial Hospital for substance impairment.  Later that day, David discharged himself from the hospital and was given a bus ticket at approximately 19:40 hours. He has not been seen by his neighbours or family since November 21, 2013.  David Czerman was depressed and on pain medication for a medical condition.  Family described Mr. Czerman as a recluse, with no friends and only left his residence to go to the local pharmacy as he had trouble walking.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, Dragon, Rose, bones skull
Left Forearm, Smurf, eagle, worm, heart
Right Forearm, Wizard, devil, rose, bird

Case reference: 2014001017.CaseDesc: On April 10, 1980, the body of an unidentified man was found at the junction of Highways 40 & 540 in Vaudreuil, Quebec. A guitar and harmonica were found with the man and he had five gold fillings.

Boots: Suede, Yellow, With clip as laces
Coat: Blue, White, Chasseur, Plaid blue and white
Nylon, Dark Blue, Anoraque, Orange lining with hood

Case reference: 2014004556.CaseDesc: On January 18, 1981, at approximately 12:00pm, Donna Bester was last seen by her boyfriend in Toronto, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Donna was supposed to check into the North York General Hospital, but did not arrive and may have been despondent.

Case reference: 2006021199.CaseDesc: Guy Labreche and Rick Dechaine were last seen at the airport in Sioux Lookout, Ontario on September 12, 1987 as they departed on a return air trip to Thunder Bay, Ontario. Mr. Labreche was the aircraft pilot and his Cessna is presumed to have crashed.

Case reference: 2006028099.CaseDesc: Diane Marie Bourne was last seen on March 6, 1976, at her residence in Ashton, Ontario. Extensive police investigation has failed to locate her.

Case reference: 2015020614.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2015, at approximately 4:00 p.m., Markmiller Kwesiga was seen for the last time near Finch Avenue and Keele Street in Toronto, Ontario.

Hat: Grey, Toque, Toque with white lettering on the front
Shoes: Brown, Light brown with black sole

Case reference: 2006021899.CaseDesc: De Qian Rang was last seen on April 20, 1992 in the Village of Elora, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance De Qian and her husband operated the 'Abacus Restaurant', south of Elora. An extensive police investigation has failed to locate Mrs. Rang.  Police suspect foul play in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2006009099.CaseDesc: John Samuel Clifford was last seen on October 10, 1987. He was fishing and hunting near Floods Landing, on Frederickshouse River, in the Township of Blount, District of Cochrane. An extensive search of the area has failed to locate him.

Boots: Rubber, Green, Red, construction safety boots
Coat: Wool, Green, Parka, hydro work jacket

Case reference: 2014000008.CaseDesc: On February 2, 2008, Christopher Hargitt, a resident of Vernon, BC, drove from Vernon to Vancouver. He was last seen by an associate, who was dropped off by Mr. Hargitt near the PNE Fairgrounds. On March 6, 2008, Christopher's vehicle was found unoccupied in East Vancouver, and he has made no contact with family or friends since that time. It is believed that Christopher may have run afoul of individuals involved in criminal activity, or fled the country to avoid these same persons.

Case reference: 2005007599.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1986, a Caucasian male was found in the Niagara River, near the Whirlpool. He was estimated to be between 50-70 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 127 lbs and his length was measured at 5’6”, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. He had large earlobes. This male also had his appendix and was uncircumcised. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Bald, Believed to be bald, with a black beard.
Teeth: All of his teeth had been lost prior to death and it is unknown if he wore dentures.
Scar: Pelvis, Bilateral inguinal (groin area) scars, 9 cm
Abdomen, Midline scar on his abdomen (possibly from a hernia operation). 10.5 cm
Deformity: Left Shoulder, Large papilloma (benign non-cancerous tumor) on the back of his left shoulder.

Case reference: 2014002978.CaseDesc: On June 6, 1982, a witness saw Louisette ST-ARNEAULT fall from the Laviolette Bridge in Trois-Rivières. Her body was never recovered.

Case reference: 2022037338.CaseDesc: At the end of August 2016, Irfanul Hoque was seen for the last time as he left his family’s residence in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014005569.CaseDesc: Steven O’Brien was last seen on March 20, 1993. He was a first-year student at Holland College’s Culinary Institute in Charlottetown when he went missing after a night out with friends. Steven was last seen walking south on Queen Street in Charlottetown, Prince Edward Island, around 1:30 am.

Case reference: 2012020175.CaseDesc: This adult male was recovered from the south arm of the Fraser River off No. 4 and Garden City Road.

Teeth: Visible Missing, No dental work done; all molars missing
Socks: Wool, Grey, work type wool socks

Case reference: 2014004516.CaseDesc: On March 19 2004, Daniel James Murray was reported missing to the RCMP in Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel slipped on ice and fell into the North Saskatchewan River in the area of Drayton Valley, Alberta. Daniel has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014005192.CaseDesc: In the late afternoon of May 12, 1980, Adjutor Lapointe was seen for the last time leaving his residence in his vehicle in Chicoutimi, Quebec. During this time, he was accompanied by an acquaintance.

Case reference: 2014002649.CaseDesc: On October 17, 1978, Garry Allen and a friend were fishing on Turtle Lake near Glaslyn, SK. Witnesses state the weather changed and the water got very rough. On October 20th, they were reported missing. A swamped canoe and the body of the friend was located, however, searches failed to locate Mr. Allen.

Case reference: 2014004681.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1965, Archie Laroque was hunting with six other people near Laroque Lake, 48 kilometers east of Carrot River, SK. The hunting party split up and Archie was last seen walking in an area alone. Extensive ground and air searches were conducted, however, Archie was never located.

Case reference: 2017073558.CaseDesc: On June 18, 2016, an unidentified man was found at the “St. Basil-the-Great College School” in Toronto, Ontario. The man had previously identified himself as John Doe, and biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that he was of East Asian ancestry.

Foreign Object: Lower Back, Fragments of old bullet in lumbar
Scar: Left Thigh, Round scar on left lateral thigh
Left Buttocks, Puckered scar on left posterior thigh
Middle Back, Mid-back on the left side
Chest, Scar in the left and right axillas
Right Chest, Scar on right nipple

Case reference: 2014004779.CaseDesc: On May 3, 2006, Mr. David Robillard left a cultural camp with the intention to walk back to his home community of Black Lake, SK. He was not seen again.

Deformity: Right Leg, walks with a limp

Case reference: 2021056657.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1990, skeletal remains were recovered from a lobster trap off the coast of Bay Roberts in Newfoundland and Labrador.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2015041172.CaseDesc: Helen Leyden was last heard from by her family sometime between 1968 and 1972. She was living in Edmonton, but is thought to have possibly gone to Vancouver during this time.
